intro: Argostemma longistipulum, commonly known as the long-stemmed argostemma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, including India, China, and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and a prominent, elongated spur. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests or along stream banks.
